newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Tadiran Telecom wins $35 mln contract.
newsitem.headline: Tadiran Telecom wins $35 mln contract.

text.p: Israel's Tadiran Telecommunications Ltd said on Tuesday it won a $35 million contract to supply military communications systems to the Spanish army.

It said it would carry out the project in cooperation with Spain's Amper company and supply the multichannel digital voice and data systems over a five-year period, with deliveries beginning this year.
France's Thomson SA and Sweden's Ericsson participated in the international tender won by Tadiran, the company said in a statement.
Tadiran Telecommunications said it is examining the possibility of investing "tens of millions of dollars" to acquire a U.S. company in the field of military communications, without naming any firms.
In addition to widening its marketing operations in the United States, Tadiran Telecommunications is also seeking cooperation deals with European companies, the company added.
The Israeli firm has already agreed to participate jointly with France's Alcatel Alsthom in European tenders for military communications equipment.
Tadiran Telecom said its orders' backlog currently stands at $300 million. The company is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tadiran Ltd.
